sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a rectangle.
message_1: A rectangle has a length of 8 meters and a width of 6 meters. What is the perimeter of the rectangle?
message_2:
The perimeter of a rectangle is given by the formula P = 2(L + W), where L is the length and W is the width. In this case, L = 8 meters and W = 6 meters.

P = 2(8 + 6)
P = 2(14)
P = 28 meters

The perimeter of the rectangle is 28 meters.
